instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
Clean, no corrosion anywhere. Only works if battery cable (j6951) is disconnected. When connected it draws up to 4a and no life but fans do spin. Caps light doesnt work this way. Disconnect the cable and it works fine with or without screw. 

Diode to ground pins on j6951 match another board. 
Tried another case/batt with no change. 
Replaced <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> in that order. No changes. 

When cable is plugged in the amp meter immediately starts at 1.6a and climbs to 4a. Without cable it starts at 0.4a goes up to 1.Xa then back down to 0.4a then starts (this is normal from what I've seen).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
Compare <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON values with the good board.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> - .2v 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> - 0v in all scenarios. 
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL> - .2v
<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - 0.1v in all scenarios. 

My only other board has no display (possibly a dead gpu) but the values match.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
forgot to add - If I connect the batt cable, connect the charger then hold power button it will shut off. I let it charge some then disconnected the charger and powered on with battery only (batt cable connected). It powers on like this but once the charger is connected it shuts off. 

Going to restore and check system info.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
Connect charger and check the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40/65.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 
no batt - 12.6v
batt - 11.3v up to 11.9v

changing those now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
same after changing Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40/65.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is still maxing out at 12v on batt/charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
Check exact ohm resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
For 0.4A and 4A power consumption, <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> should be significantly different.
Check <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/21/22, <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR>/61/62 and their traces too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 are 3.4ohm and 2.9 ohm which matches another board. 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> starts at .1v and goes up to .840v at 4.14a.
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/21/22, <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR>/61/62 and their traces are all good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message: Does the board boot with battery and charger in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
It does not. 
I just noticed that it doesn’t need the charger to start initially after battery disconnect. Connecting the battery and pressing the power button is all it takes. This is abnormal. 
this may prevent me from being able to do smc bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
So machine works with charger, or battery alone, but doesn't boot if both are connected?

What happens if start with battery alone and connect charger later?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot with battery cable
threads.message:
With charger no battery - works.

With battery no charger - fans spin but no caps light or display. Responds to power button. previously it turned on with just battery but I plugged the charger in and it shut off. Hasn’t worked off battery since.

Dead battery no charger - dead battery symbol pops up.
